text:
When I set an AddDescription for a directory, it gets inherited to all subfolders and files in that directory. In some (or many?) cases this makes no sense, description should be applied only to one directory.

I think a new IndexOptions could be added, something like 
DescriptionInherit=All|Files|Off 

Example: "Utils", "Compression related tools for Linux, DOS and Windows", but then this long text is added to every single subdirectory and file. Unless I would define new descriptions for them, or I define this:

AddDescription " " *

(Actually, I wanted to label only the topmost 10 directories of an FTP site, to help users, and then I realized that everything gets all the way down. I wonder if this inherit is useful in any case...is it?)

Thanks in advance!
creator: lion@netngine.hu

text:
You should use scoping rules (e.g. FilesMatch) to apply in a single directory.

What you're asking contradicts standard behaviour, and would therefore require "special case" implementation, meaning extra complexity and inelegance.
creator: nick@webthing.com
